data.title: FOUR APPOINTED TO DSU ATHLETICS POSTS
data.meta_description: DOVER (April 15, 2008) --- Delaware State University Director of Athletics Rick Costello has announced four appointments to the athletics department staff. Pegjohngy
data.text:
Dover (April 15, 2008) --- Delaware State University Director of Athletics Rick Costello has announced four appointments to the athletics department staff. Pegjohngy "PJ" Moses has been appointed Associate Athletic Director for Internal Operations; George E. Robinson II is Delaware State's new Director of Athletic Development; Matt Millet has been named Assistant Athletics Director for Marketing and Corporate Partnerships; Franklin Randy Meredith has been named DSU Ticket Manager.

"We are excited to have PJ join our staff," said Costello. "Her experience in intercollegiate athletics and wealth of knowledge in NCAA Compliance will be invaluable to our department."

Prior to her DSU appointment, Moses was assistant athletic director for compliance and senior woman administrator at the University of Texas-Pan American for four years.

Moses has also served in collegiate athletics compliance at Tennessee-Chattanooga, Central Florida and Cornell.

A native of Plant City, Fla., Moses earned a bachelor's in political science/history from Duke University and law degree from Tulane.

Her responsibilities at Delaware State include athletics compliance, eligibility and student welfare.

"Development, Marketing and Fundraising are key elements in a successful athletic department," said Costello. "Creating revenue streams through marketing and promotions of our program is vital. Both George and Matt possess the experience needed to create awareness and build corporate partnerships in the Delaware community."

A native of West Chester, Pa., Robinson has an extensive background in marketing, sales, promotions and fundraising.

He most recently served as director of the athletic annual fund at Southern Illinois University since 2004.

His experience also includes marketing assistant at the University of Florida and assistant director of marketing and promotions at Virginia Tech University.

Robinson earned a master's in sports administration from Grambling State University and a bachelor's in business management from Norfolk State University.

Millet most recently served as director of corporate partnerships for Floyd Hall Enterprises, owner of the Can-Am League Sussex Skyhawks and New Jersey Jackals minor league baseball clubs. In this role, Matt created corporate partnerships with Toyota, Allstate, Dick's Sporting Goods, Burger King and Pizza Hut.

He also spent six years as director of corporate sales and ticket operations with the New Jersey Cardinals, Single A affiliate of Major League Baseball's St. Louis Cardinals.

Millet has also served as a public relations intern with the National Hockey League's Pittsburgh Penguins and was employed with Nilon Amusement, Inc., providing concessions for major golf tournaments, including the U.S. Open.

A graduate of Robert Morris University in Pittsburgh, Pa., Millet currently resides in Dover with his wife Kelly and daughter Lily.

"As a DSU graduate, Randy exudes Hornet Pride and will carry that over into the ticket office," said Costello. "He possesses excellent customer service which is vital in his position. Randy is an excellent addition to our staff."

Meredith has served in the marketing and promotions department for the Wilmington (Del.) Blue Rocks minor league baseball organization. He was the Blue Rocks' clubhouse director during the 2007 season.

Meredith earned a bachelor's in sports management from Delaware State University in 2006 and is pursuing a master's in DSU's sports administration program.
